intro: Chaetogastra venosa, commonly known as the veined chaetogastra, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are ovate with prominent veins, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Chaetogastra venosa is often found in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or shrubland habitats.
